DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Speed [SSPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Set Direction [SDIR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query [QUERY]
    Toggle Power [TPWR]
  ***Send Commands***
    Speed Changed [SPDCHG]
    Direction Changed [DIRCHG]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the ceiling fan to medium speed and reverse its direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed can be set to Off, Low, Medium, or High, with Medium corresponding to the enum value [2]. The direction can be Forward [0] or Reverse [1]. The accepted commands to change these are Set Speed [SSPD] and Set Direction [SDIR], each requiring the appropriate enum parameter.

To fulfill the request, I will issue Set Speed with parameter Medium (2) and Set Direction with parameter Reverse (1).

Result: Send SSPD with parameter 2 to set speed to Medium, and SDIR with parameter 1 to set direction to Reverse.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Range 0.0 to 50.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Temperature Report [TMPREP]
    Power Status Report [PWRREP]

USER QUERY:
I want to increase the water heater temperature to 60 degrees Celsius and turn it on.

I first identify the relevant properties and commands. The temperature property ranges from 30 to 75 °C, and the power status can be On or Off. To increase the temperature to 60 °C, the Set Temperature [STMP] command is used with parameter 60. To turn the heater on, the Power On [PON] command is used.

Step-by-step, I will send STMP with 60 °C to set the temperature, then send PON to power on the device.

Result: Execute STMP(60) to set temperature and PON to turn the water heater on.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Open [OPEN]
    Close [CLOSE]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Position Report [POSREP]
    Status Report [STREP]

USER QUERY:
Could you open the window blinds halfway?

The device has a Position property ranging from 0 to 100%, where 0% is fully closed and 100% is fully open. The accepted commands include Set Position [SPOS] with a percentage parameter, Open [OPEN], and Close [CLOSE].

To open the blinds halfway, I will set the position to 50% using the Set Position command.

Result: Send SPOS with parameter 50 to open the blinds halfway.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: Smart Garage Door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPN]
    Close Door [CLS]
    Lock Door [LCK]
    Unlock Door [ULK]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Door Status Report [DSTAT]
    Lock Status Report [LSTAT]

USER QUERY:
Please unlock the garage door and open it.

The garage door has two main properties: Door Status and Lock Status, each with enumerated states. To unlock the door, the Unlock Door [ULK] command is used, and to open it, the Open Door [OPN] command is used.

Step-by-step, I will first send ULK to unlock the door, then OPN to open it.

Result: Execute ULK to unlock the garage door, followed by OPN to open it.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

  ***Send Commands***
    Temperature Report [TMPREP]

USER QUERY:
Can you lower the refrigerator temperature to -2 degrees Celsius and make sure it is powered on?

The refrigerator's temperature property ranges from -5 to 10 °C. To lower the temperature to -2 °C, the Set Temperature [STMP] command with parameter -2 is appropriate. The power status can be On or Off, controlled by Power On [PON] and Power Off [POF] commands.

I will first set the temperature to -2 °C using STMP(-2), then ensure the refrigerator is powered on by sending PON.

Result: Send STMP with -2 to set temperature and PON to power on the refrigerator.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Filter Status
      Enum
        Good [0]
        Replace Soon [1]
        Replace Now [2]
    Power
      Enum
        On [1]
        Off [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Fan Speed [SFAN]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [1]
          Medium [2]
          High [3]
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Fan Speed Report [FSPREP]
    Filter Status Report [FILTREP]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high.

The air purifier has a Power property with On and Off states, and a Fan Speed property with Low, Medium, and High options. To turn it on, use Power On [PON]. To set fan speed to High, use Set Fan Speed [SFAN] with parameter High (3).

Step-by-step, I will send PON to power on the device, then SFAN with parameter 3 to set fan speed to High.

Result: Execute PON to turn on the purifier and SFAN(3) to set fan speed to High.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Irrigation Controller
  ***Properties***
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        True [1]
        False [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Flow Rate [SFLW]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Enable Zone [ENZ]
    Disable Zone [DISZ]
    Enable Schedule [ENSCH]
    Disable Schedule [DSSCH]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Flow Rate Report [FLWREP]
    Zone Status Report [ZSTREP]

USER QUERY:
Can you enable the irrigation zone and set the water flow rate to 15 liters per minute?

The irrigation controller has a Water Flow Rate property ranging from 0 to 20 L/min and a Zone Status property with Off and On states. To enable the zone, use Enable Zone [ENZ]. To set flow rate to 15 L/min, use Set Flow Rate [SFLW] with parameter 15.

Step-by-step, I will send ENZ to enable the zone, then SFLW with 15 to set the flow rate.

Result: Execute ENZ to enable the zone and SFLW(15) to set water flow rate to 15 L/min.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Bake [1]
        Broil [2]
        Roast [3]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SMOD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Bake [1]
          Broil [2]
          Roast [3]
    Set Timer [STMR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Temperature Report [TMPREP]
    Mode Report [MODREP]
    Timer Report [TMRREP]

USER QUERY:
I want to bake at 180 degrees Celsius for 45 minutes. How do I set that?

The oven's temperature property ranges from 50 to 300 °C, mode includes Bake, Broil, Roast, and Off, and the timer can be set from 0 to 180 minutes. To bake at 180 °C for 45 minutes, I need to set the temperature to 180, mode to Bake (1), and timer to 45.

Step-by-step, send Set Temperature [STMP] with 180, Set Mode [SMOD] with Bake (1), and Set Timer [STMR] with 45.

Result: Execute STMP(180), SMOD(1), and STMR(45) to bake at 180 °C for 45 minutes.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Humidifier
  ***Properties***
    Humidity Level
      Range 30 to 70 Unit %
    Power Status
      Enum
        On [1]
        Off [0]
    Water Tank Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Humidity [SHUM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30 to 70 Unit %
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Humidity Report [HUMREP]
    Water Tank Report [WTREP]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the humidifier and set the humidity level to 55 percent. Also, tell me if the water tank is full.

The humidifier has a Humidity Level property ranging from 30 to 70%, and a Power Status property with On and Off states. The Water Tank Level ranges from 0 to 100%. To turn it on, use Power On [PON]. To set humidity to 55%, use Set Humidity [SHUM] with parameter 55.

To check if the water tank is full, I will interpret 100% as full.

Step-by-step, send PON to power on, SHUM(55) to set humidity, and query the Water Tank Level property.

Result: Execute PON and SHUM(55). If Water Tank Level is 100%, the tank is full; otherwise, it is not full.
